content.question: A curve in the <math alttext="x y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-plane is defined by <math alttext="open parenthesis, x of t, comma, y of t, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>,</mo><mi>y</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="x of t, equals the sine of 2 t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="y of t, equals the cosine of 3 t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following is equivalent to <math alttext="the derivative, with respect to t, of, open parenthesis, x of t, comma, y of t, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>,</mo><mi>y</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="open parenthesis, the cosine of 2 t, comma, the sine of 3 t, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, 2 times the cosine of 2 t, comma, negative 3 times the sine of 3 t, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, 2 times cosine of 2 t, comma, 3 times sine of 2 t, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, negative 2 times the cosine of 2 t, comma, negative 3 times the sine of 3 t, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="open parenthesis, 2 times the cosine of 2 t, comma, negative 3 times the sine of 3 t, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

unit.text: 9: Parametric Equations, Polar Coordinates, and Vector-Valued Functions

topic.text: 9.1: (BC ONLY) Defining and Differentiating Parametric Equations

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
